a.style: font-family:"Playfair Display", Georgia, "Times New Roman", serif

text.tspan: Change in per capita CO₂ emissions and GDP, United States
Annual consumption-based emissions are domestic emissions adjusted for trade. If a country imports goods the CO₂
emissions caused in the production of those goods are added to its domestic emissions; if it exports goods then this
Source: Data compiled from multiple sources by World Bank, Our World in Data based on the Global Carbon Project
Note: GDP figures are adjusted for inflation over time.
